subtitle: Have a skilled birth attendant
title: How to have a safe birth
content:
Created by BabyCenter

It is safest, and recommended, to give birth in a health facility, where there is help if there are problems.

If you cannot have your baby at a health facility, here is how to have a safe birth.

 - 	Plan to have a skilled birth attendant, such as a registered midwife or nurse from the government clinic with you. She will help you to give birth safely and she will do what is necessary if there is a problem.

 - 	Make sure you have her phone number so you can call her in an emergency. 

 - 	Have ambulance and taxi numbers ready and make sure you have enough credit on the phone. 

 - 	Make sure your family knows how to contact the midwife when it is time. 

 - 	Make sure you have a birth kit ready. Your midwife may bring a birth kit. It will contain a sheet, gloves, clean string and tools for cutting your baby's cord. All these items are important for a clean, safe birth. 

 - 	If you cannot get a birth kit, find a clean sheet to have your baby on and 2 cloths, one to dry your baby and one to wrap her in. Have 2 pieces of clean string, a clean, sharp knife or a clean pair of scissors ready. Your midwife must wash her hands and you must wash between your legs. Get plenty of clean, boiled water and soap ready.
